intro: Echium font-queri, commonly known as the Spanish thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and spiny leaves. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and arid environments. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium font-queri is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
